intro: Chirita floribunda, commonly known as the clustered chervil, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. Chirita floribunda is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and containers due to its ornamental value.
